text: The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, of the priests that were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin:
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom the word of the LORD came in the days of Josiah the son of Amon king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign.
speaker: Narrator

text: It came also in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, unto the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah the son of Josiah king of Judah unto the carrying away of Jerusalem captive in the fifth month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Before I formed thee in the belly I knew thee; and before thou camest forth out of the womb I sanctified thee, and I ordained thee a prophet unto the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said, Ah, Lord GOD! behold, I do not know how to speak: for I am a child.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the LORD said unto me, Do not say, I am a child; for thou shalt go to all that I shall send thee, and whatsoever I command thee thou shalt speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be afraid of their faces; for I am with thee to deliver thee, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD put forth his hand and touched my mouth. And the LORD said unto me, Behold, I have put my words in thy mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, I have placed thee in this day over Gentiles and over kingdoms, to root out, and to destroy, and to throw out, and to cast down, to build, and to plant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, Jeremiah, what seest thou? And I said, I see a rod of an almond tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto me, Thou hast seen well, for I will hasten my word to perform it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the LORD came unto me the second time, saying, What seest thou? And I said, I see a seething pot; and its face is toward the north.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto me, Out of the north an evil shall break forth upon all the inhabitants of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, I will call all the families of the kingdoms of the north, saith the LORD; and they shall come, and each one shall set his seat at the entering of the gates of Jerusalem and near all its walls round about and near all the cities of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will utter my judgments against them touching all their wickedness, who have forsaken me and have burned incense unto other gods and worshipped the works of their own hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou therefore gird up thy loins, and thou shalt arise and speak unto them all that I shall command thee; do not fear them lest I confound thee before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, I have made thee this day as a defenced city and as an iron pillar and as a wall of brass upon all the earth against the kings of Judah, against its princes, against its priests, and against the people of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall fight against thee; but they shall not prevail against thee; for I am with thee, saith the LORD, to deliver thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Go and cry out in the ears of Jerusalem, saying, Thus saith the LORD: I remember thee, the mercy of thy youth, the love of thine espousals, when thou didst go after me in the wilderness, in a land that was not sown.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel was holiness unto the LORD and the firstfruits of his increase; all that devour him shall be found guilty; evil shall come upon them, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear ye the word of the LORD, O house of Jacob, and all the families of the house of Israel;
speaker: Narrator

text: thus hath the LORD said, What iniquity have your fathers found in me that they are gone far from me and have walked after vanity and are become vain?
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither did they say, Where is the LORD that brought us up out of the land of Egypt, that led us through the wilderness, through a land of deserts and of pits, through a land of drought and of the shadow of death, through a land that no man passed through and where no man dwelt?
speaker: Narrator

text: And I brought you into a plentiful country to eat the fruit thereof and the goodness thereof; but when ye entered, ye defiled my land and made my heritage an abomination.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priests did not say, Where is the LORD? and those that handled the law did not know me; the pastors also rebelled against me, and the prophets prophesied by Baal and walked after things that do not profit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will yet enter into judgment with you, saith the LORD, and I will plead with your children’s children.
speaker: Narrator

text: For pass over the isles of Chittim and see; and send unto Kedar and consider diligently and see if there be such a thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Has a nation changed their gods? Even though they are not gods. But my people have changed their glory for that which does not profit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be astonished, O ye heavens, at this; and be horribly afraid, be ye very desolate, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my people have committed two evils: they have forsaken me the fountain of living waters to hew them out cisterns, broken cisterns, that can hold no water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is Israel a slave? Is he a homeborn slave? Why has he been given over as a prey?
speaker: Narrator

text: The young lions roared upon him and yelled, and they made his land waste: his cities are deserted without inhabitant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even the sons of Noph and Tahapanes have broken the crown of thy head.
speaker: Narrator

text: Could this not have come upon you peradventure because thou hast forsaken the LORD thy God, when he led thee by the way?
speaker: Narrator

text: And now what hast thou to do in the way of Egypt? to drink the waters of the Nile? or what hast thou to do in the way of Assyria? to drink the waters of the river Eufrates?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine own wickedness shall chastise thee, and thy backslidings shall reprove thee; know therefore and see how evil and bitter it is, that thou hast forsaken the LORD thy God and that my fear is lacking in thee, saith the Lord GOD of the hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: For of old time I have broken thy yoke and burst thy bands; and thou didst say, I will not serve sin. With all this, upon every high hill and under every green tree thou dost wander, playing the harlot.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I had planted thee a noble vine, a seed of Truth, all of her; how then art thou turned into the degenerate plant of a strange vine unto me?
speaker: Narrator

text: For though thou wash thee with nitre and take thee much soap, yet thine iniquity is sealed before me, saith the Lord GOD.
speaker: Narrator

text: How canst thou say, I am not polluted, I have not gone after Baalim? See thy way in the valley, know what thou hast done: thou art a swift dromedary traversing her ways;
speaker: Narrator

text: a wild ass used to the wilderness that breathes according to the desire of her soul; from her lust, who shall stop her? All those that seek her will not weary themselves; in her month they shall find her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Withhold thy foot from being unshod and thy throat from thirst; but thou didst say, There is no hope: no; for I have loved strangers, and after them I will go.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the thief is ashamed when he is taken, so shall the house of Israel be ashamed: they, their kings, their princes, and their priests, and their prophets,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying to a piece of firewood, Thou art my father; and to a stone, Thou hast brought me forth: for they have turned their back unto me, and not their face: but in the time of their trouble they say, Arise and deliver us.
speaker: Narrator

text: But where are thy gods that thou hast made thee? Let them arise, if they can save thee in the time of thy trouble, for according to the number of thy cities were thy gods, O Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why will ye plead with me? Ye have all rebelled against me, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have smitten your children in vain; they have received no correction; your own sword has devoured your prophets, like a destroying lion.
speaker: Narrator

text: O generation, see ye the word of the LORD. Have I been a wilderness unto Israel? a land of darkness? Why do my people say, We are lords; we will come no more unto thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall the virgin, perchance, forget her ornaments, or a bride her attire? yet my people have forgotten me days without number.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why dost thou trim thy way to seek love? therefore thou hast also taught the wicked ones thy ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even in thy skirts is found the blood of the souls of the poor innocents; thou didst not find them in any trespass, but by all these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet thou didst say, Because I am innocent, surely his anger shall turn from me. Behold, I will enter into judgment with thee because thou hast said, I did not sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why dost thou talk so much, changing thy ways? Thou shalt also be ashamed of Egypt, as thou wast ashamed of Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also go forth from him with thine hands upon thine head; for the LORD has rejected thy confidences, and thou shalt not prosper in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They say, If a man puts away his wife and she goes from him and becomes another man’s, shall he return unto her again? Is she not a land that is now completely polluted? but thou hast played the harlot with many lovers; yet return again to me, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up thine eyes unto the high places and see if there is anywhere thou hast not been ravished. In the ways hast thou sat for them, as the Arabian in the wilderness; and thou hast polluted the land with thy whoredoms and with thy wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the rain has been withheld, and there has been no latter rain; and thou dost have a whore’s forehead, thou dost refuse to be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wilt thou not from this time cry unto me, My father, thou art the guide of my youth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Will he reserve his anger for ever? will he keep it to the end? Behold, thou hast spoken and done as many evil things as thou could.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD said unto me in the days of Josiah the king, Hast thou seen that which rebellious Israel has done? She is gone up upon every high mountain and under every green tree, and there has played the harlot.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I said after she had done all these things, Turn thou unto me. But she did not return. And her rebellious sister Judah saw it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I saw when for all the causes by which rebellious Israel committed adultery, I had put her away and given her a bill of divorce; yet her rebellious sister Judah did not fear, but went and played the harlot also.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass through her judging her whoredom to be a light thing that the land became defiled and committed adultery with stones and with stocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And yet for all this her rebellious sister Judah has never turned unto me with her whole heart, but untruthfully, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto me, The rebellious Israel has justified her soul in comparison to the treacherous Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go and proclaim these words toward the north wind and say, Return, thou rebellious Israel, said the LORD and I will not cause my anger to fall upon you; for I am merciful, said the LORD, and I will not keep anger for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only acknowledge thine iniquity that thou hast rebelled against the LORD thy God and hast scattered thy ways to the strangers under every green tree, and ye have not heard my voice, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn, O rebellious sons, said the LORD; for I am your Lord, and I will take you one of a city and two of a family, and I will bring you to Zion:
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will give you pastors according to my heart, which shall feed you with knowledge and understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, when ye are multiplied and increased in the land; in those days, said the LORD, they shall no longer say, The ark of the covenant of the LORD: neither shall it come to mind: neither shall they remember it; neither shall they visit it; neither shall that be done any more.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time they shall call Jerusalem the throne of the LORD; and all the Gentiles shall congregate unto it in the name of the LORD in Jerusalem; neither shall they walk any more after the hardness of their evil heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those times they shall go out from the house of Judah unto the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north wind to the land which I caused your fathers to inherit.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I said, How shall I place thee as sons and give thee the desirable land, the heritage that the hosts of Gentiles desire? and I said, Thou shalt call me, My father, and shalt not turn away from following me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely as the woman breaks the faith of her husband, so have ye dealt treacherously with me, O house of Israel, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: A voice was heard upon the high places, weeping of the supplications of the sons of Israel; for they have perverted their way, and they have forgotten the LORD their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Return, ye rebellious sons, and I will heal your rebellion. Behold, we come unto thee; for thou art the LORD our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly the hills are vanity, the multitude of mountains; truly in the LORD our God is the salvation of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For shame has devoured the labour of our fathers from our youth: their flocks and their herds, their sons and their daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: We lie down in our shame, and our confusion covers us; for we have sinned against the LORD our God, we and our fathers, from our youth even unto this day, and have not hearkened unto the voice of the LORD our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou wilt return unto me, O Israel, said the LORD, thou shalt have rest; and if thou wilt put away thine abominations out of my sight, then thou shalt not go into captivity.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt swear, The LORD lives, in truth, in judgment, and in righteousness; and the Gentiles shall bless themselves in him, and in him shall they glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus has the LORD said to every man of Judah and of Jerusalem, Break up your fallow ground, and do not sow among thorns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Circumcise yourselves to the LORD, and take away the foreskins of your heart, ye men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem lest my fury come forth like fire and burn so that no one can quench it because of the evil of your doings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Declare ye in Judah and publish in Jerusalem and say, Blow ye the shofar in the land; cry, gather together, and say, Assemble yourselves, and let us go into the defenced cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Set up the banner in Zion: come together, do not delay: for I bring evil from the north wind, and a great destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lion is come up from his den, and the destroyer of the Gentiles is on his way; he is gone forth from his place to make thy land desolate; and thy cities shall be laid waste, without an inhabitant.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this, gird yourselves with sackcloth; lament and howl; for the fierce anger of the LORD is not turned back from us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass at that day, saith the LORD, that the heart of the king shall perish, and the heart of the princes; and the priests shall be astonished, and the prophets shall wonder.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Then I said, Ah, Lord GOD! surely thou hast greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall have peace; when the sword reaches unto the soul.)
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time it shall be said to this people and to Jerusalem, A dry wind of the high places of the wilderness came toward the daughter of my people, not to fan, nor to cleanse.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wind much more violent than these shall come unto me; for now I will also speak judgments against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, he shall come up as a cloud, and his chariots as a whirlwind; his horses are swifter than eagles. Woe unto us, for we are given over to be spoiled!
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jerusalem, wash thine heart from wickedness that thou may be saved. How long shalt thou entertain the thoughts of thy iniquity within thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: For the voice is heard from him who brings the news from Dan and from him who causes to hear the affliction from Mount Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say ye of the Gentiles; behold, cause it to be heard upon Jerusalem, Watchmen come from a far country and shall give out their voice upon the cities of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the watchmen of the heritages, they were upon her round about because she has been rebellious against me, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy way and thy doings have procured these things unto thee; this is thy wickedness because it is bitter, because it reaches unto thine heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: My bowels, my bowels! I am pained at my very heart; my heart makes a noise in me; I cannot hold my peace because thou hast heard, O my soul, the sound of the shofar, the alarm of war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Destruction upon destruction is cried, for the whole land is destroyed; suddenly are my tents destroyed, and my curtains in a moment.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long shall I see the banner and hear the voice of the shofar?
speaker: Narrator

text: For my people are foolish; the ignorant sons with no understanding have not known me; they are wise to do evil, but to do good they have no knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: I beheld the earth, and, behold, it was without order, and empty; and the heavens, and they had no light.
speaker: Narrator

text: I beheld the mountains, and, behold, they trembled, and all the hills were destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I beheld, and, behold, there was no man, and all the birds of the heavens had fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: I beheld, and, behold, Carmel was a wilderness, and all its cities were broken down at the presence of the LORD and by his fierce anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus hath the LORD said, The whole land shall be desolate; yet I will not make a full end.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this shall the earth be made desolate, and the heavens above be darkened because I spoke; I purposed and did not repent, neither will I turn back from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The whole city fled from the thunder of the horsemen and bowmen; they went into the thickets of the forests and climbed up upon the rocks; every city was forsaken, and not a man dwells therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou who art destroyed, what wilt thou do? Though thou clothe thyself with crimson, though thou deck thee with ornaments of gold, though thou paint thy eyes with antimony, in vain shalt thou make thyself fair; thy lovers will despise thee; they will seek thy life.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail, the anguish as of her that brings forth her first child, the voice of the daughter of Zion, that bewails herself, that spreads her hands, saying, Woe is me now! for my soul is faint because of the murderers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Run ye to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem and see now and find out and seek in the broad places thereof, if ye can find a man, if there be any that execute judgment, that seek the truth; and I will pardon the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if they should say, The LORD lives; surely they swear falsely.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD, are not thine eyes upon the truth? Thou hast stricken them, but they did not feel it; thou hast consumed them, but they have refused to receive chastisement; they have made their faces harder than a rock; they have refused to return.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I said, Surely these are poor; they have become foolish; for they do not know the way of the LORD nor the judgment of their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will go unto the great men, and will speak unto them; for they have known the way of the LORD, and the judgment of their God: but these have altogether broken the yoke and burst the bonds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore a lion out of the forest shall slay them, and a wolf of the desert shall destroy them and a tiger shall lie in wait over their cities; anyone that goes out from there shall be torn in pieces because their rebellions have been multiplied, and their backslidings are increased.
speaker: Narrator

text: How shall I pardon thee for this? Thy sons have forsaken me and sworn by them that are not gods: when I had fed them to the full, they then committed adultery and assembled themselves by troops in the harlots’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were as fed horses in the morning; each one neighed after his neighbour’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall I not visit for these things? said the LORD; and shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
speaker: Narrator

text: Go ye up upon her walls and destroy; but make not a full end; take away her battlements for they are not the LORD’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have made a firm decision to rebel against me, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have denied the LORD and said, He is not; and evil shall not come upon us; neither shall we see sword nor famine;
speaker: Narrator

text: but the prophets shall become like wind, and there is no word in them: thus shall it be done unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus hath the LORD God of the hosts said: Because ye have spoken this word, behold, I will make my words in thy mouth fire and this people wood, and it shall devour them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I will bring a nation upon you from afar, O house of Israel, saith the LORD; it is a mighty nation, it is an ancient nation, a nation whose language thou dost not know, neither dost thou understand what they say.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their quiver is as an open sepulcher; they are all mighty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall eat up thine harvest and thy bread, which thy sons and thy daughters should eat: they shall eat up thy flocks and thine herds; they shall eat up thy vines and thy fig trees; and thy fenced cities, in which thou dost trust, they shall bring to nothing with the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless in those days, saith the LORD, I will not make a full end with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, when ye shall say, Why does the LORD our God do all these things unto us? Then thou shalt answer them, Like as ye have forsaken me and served strange gods in your land, so shall ye serve strangers in a land that is not yours.
speaker: Narrator

text: Declare this in the house of Jacob and publish it in Judah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear now this, O foolish people and without heart, who have eyes and do not see; who have ears, and do not hear:
speaker: Narrator

text: Do ye not fear me? saith the LORD; will ye not tremble at my presence, who placed the sand for the bound of the sea by an eternal order, which cannot be broken? Storms shall raise themselves up, yet they shall not prevail; their waves shall roar, yet they shall not pass over it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But this people have a false and rebellious heart; they turned and went.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither do they say in their heart, Let us now fear the LORD our God that gives rain, both the former and the latter, in its season; he shall keep us with the appointed weeks of the harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your iniquities have turned away these things, and your sins have withheld good things from you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For among my people were found wicked men: they lay in wait as he that sets snares; they set a trap of perdition to catch men.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a cage full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit; thus they became great and rich.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are become fat; they shine; yea, they overpass in deeds of wickedness; they did not judge the cause, the cause of the fatherless; with all this they made themselves prosperous; and they did not judge the cause of the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall I not visit for these things? saith the LORD; shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
speaker: Narrator

text: A horrible and ugly thing is committed in the land:
speaker: Narrator

text: The prophets prophesied falsely, and the priests bore rule by their hands; and my people love to have it so. What will ye do in the end thereof?
speaker: Narrator

text: O ye sons of Benjamin, gather yourselves to flee out of the midst of Jerusalem and blow the shofar in Tekoa and set up as a sign smoke in Bethhaccerem; for evil appears out of the north wind and great destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: I shall liken the daughter of Zion to a comely and delicate woman.
speaker: Narrator

text: The shepherds with their flocks shall come unto her; they shall pitch their tents against her round about; they shall feed each one his portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Prepare ye war against her; arise, and let us go up towards the south. Woe unto us! for the day goes away, for the shadows of the evening are stretched out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, and let us go up by night, and let us destroy her palaces.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus hath the LORD of the hosts said, Hew ye down trees and cast a mount against Jerusalem; this is the city that all of her is to be visited; there is violence in the midst of her.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the waters never cease to flow from a fountain, so her wickedness never ceases to flow; injustice and robbery is heard in her; in my presence continually, sickness and wounds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chastise Jerusalem lest peradventure my soul be disjointed from thee, lest peradventure I make thee desolate, a land not inhabited.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD of the hosts said, They shall thoroughly glean the remnant of Israel as a vine; turn back thine hand as a grapegatherer into the baskets.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom shall I speak, and give warning that they may hear? behold, their ears are uncircumcised, and they cannot hearken, behold, the word of the LORD is unto them a reproach; they have no delight in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I am full of the fury of the LORD; I have worked hard to hold myself in from pouring it out upon the children in the street, and upon the assembly of young men together; for the husband with the wife shall also be taken, the aged with him that is full of days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their houses shall be turned unto others, with their fields and wives together; for I will stretch out my hand upon the inhabitants of the land, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: For from the least of them even unto the greatest of them each one is given to greed; and from the prophet even unto the priest every one deals falsely.
speaker: Narrator

text: They treat also the destruction of the daughter of my people lightly, saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? no, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush; therefore, they shall fall among those that shall fall: at the time that I visit them they shall fall, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD said, Stand ye in the ways and see and ask for the old paths, where the good way is and walk therein, and ye shall find rest for your souls. But they said, We will not walk therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I set watchmen over you, saying, Hearken to the sound of the shofar. But they said, We will not hearken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore hear, ye Gentiles, and know, O congregation of Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O earth: behold, I will bring evil upon this people, even the fruit of their thoughts because they have not hearkened unto my words, and they hated my law.
speaker: Narrator

text: To what purpose does this incense come to me from Sheba and the sweet cane from a far country? Your burnt offerings are not according to my will, nor are your sacrifices sweet unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will lay stumblingblocks before this people, and the fathers and the sons together shall fall upon them; the neighbour and his friend shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD said, Behold, a people come from the land of the north wind, and a great nation shall be raised from the sides of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall lay hold on bow and spear; they are cruel, and they shall have no mercy; their voice shall roar like the sea; and they shall ride upon horses set in array as men for war against thee, O daughter of Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have heard the fame thereof; our hands wax feeble; anguish has taken hold of us, and pain as of a woman in travail.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not go forth into the field, nor walk by the way; for the sword of the enemy and fear is on every side.
speaker: Narrator

text: O daughter of my people, gird thee with sackcloth and wallow thyself in ashes; make thee mourning, as for an only son, most bitter lamentation; for the destroyer shall suddenly come upon us.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have set thee for a tower and a fortress among my people; thou shalt know and examine their way.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are all rebellious princes; they walk with deception: they are brass and iron; they are all corrupters.
speaker: Narrator

text: The bellows are burned; the lead is consumed of the fire; the founder melts in vain; for the wicked are not plucked away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reprobate silver shall men call them because the LORD has rejected them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word that was sent to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Stand in the gate of the LORD’s house and proclaim there this word and say, Hear the word of the LORD, all ye of Judah that enter in at these gates to worship the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD of the hosts the God of Israel said, Amend your ways and your doings, and I will cause you to dwell in this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not trust in lying words, saying, The temple of the LORD, The temple of the LORD, The temple of the LORD are these.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if ye thoroughly amend your ways and your doings, if ye thoroughly do right between a man and his neighbour,
speaker: Narrator

text: if ye do not oppress the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, and shed no innocent blood in this place, neither walk after other gods to your hurt,
speaker: Narrator

text: then I will cause you to dwell in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, ye trust in lying words that cannot profit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Will ye steal, murder, and commit adultery, and swear falsely, and burn incense unto Baal, and walk after other gods whom ye know not,
speaker: Narrator

text: and come and stand before me in this house, which is called by my name, and say, We are free to do all these abominations?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is this house, which is called by my name, become a den of robbers in your eyes? Behold, even I have seen it, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: But go now unto my place which was in Shiloh, where I set my name at the first and see what I did to it for the wickedness of my people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now because ye have done all these works, said the LORD and I spoke well unto you, rising up early and speaking, but ye did not hear; and I called you, but ye did not answer;
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore I will do unto this house, which is called by my name, in which ye trust, and unto this place which I gave to you and to your fathers, as I have done to Shiloh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will cast you out of my sight as I have cast out all your brethren, even the whole seed of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up cry nor prayer for them, neither make intercession to me: for I will not hear thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dost thou not see what they do in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons gather wood, and the fathers kindle the fire, and the women knead their dough to make cakes to the queen of heaven and to pour out drink offerings unto other gods that they may provoke me to anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall they provoke me to anger? said the LORD: do they not provoke themselves to the confusion of their own faces?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus hath the Lord GOD said: Behold, my anger and my fury shall be poured out upon this place, upon man and upon beast and upon the trees of the field and upon the fruit of the ground, and it shall burn and shall not be quenched.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD of the hosts, the God of Israel said: Add your burnt offerings upon your sacrifices and eat flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I did not speak unto your fathers, nor command them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt concerning burnt offerings or sacrifices:
speaker: Narrator

text: But this thing I commanded them, saying, Hear my voice, and I will be your God, and ye shall be my people: and walk ye in all the way that I have commanded you that it may be well unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they did not hearken, nor incline their ear, but walked in their own counsels in the imagination of their evil heart and went backward, and not forward
speaker: Narrator

text: since the day that your fathers came forth out of the land of Egypt unto this day. I have even sent unto you all my slaves, the prophets, daily rising up early and sending them;
speaker: Narrator

text: yet they did not hearken unto me, nor incline their ear, but hardened their neck: they did worse than their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou shalt speak all these words unto them; but they will not hearken to thee: thou shalt even call unto them; but they will not answer thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou shalt say unto them, This is the nation that did not hear the voice of the LORD their God, nor receive chastisement; the faith is lost and was cut off from their mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cut off thine hair, O Jerusalem, and cast it away and take up a lamentation on high places; for the LORD has cast off and forsaken the nation of his wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the sons of Judah have done evil in my sight, said the LORD; they have set their abominations in the house which is called by my name to pollute it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they have built the high places of Tophet, which is in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and their daughters in the fire, which I did not command them, neither did it come into my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that it shall no longer be called Tophet, nor the valley of the son of Hinnom, but the valley of slaughter; for they shall bury in Tophet, for there shall be no other place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the carcasses of this people shall be food for the fowls of the heaven and for the beasts of the earth; and there shall be no one to chase them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will cause to cease from the cities of Judah and from the streets of Jerusalem, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom, and the voice of the bride: for the land shall be desolate.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time, said the LORD, they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah and the bones of his princes and the bones of the priests and the bones of the prophets and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall spread them before the sun and the moon and all the host of heaven, whom they have loved and whom they have served and after whom they have walked and whom they have sought and whom they have worshipped: they shall not be gathered, nor be buried; they shall be for dung upon the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And death shall be chosen rather than life by all the residue of those that remain of this evil generation, in all the places where I have driven those that remain, said the LORD of the hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover thou shalt say unto them, Thus hath the LORD said: The one who falls, does he never arise? he who turns away, does he never return?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why then is this people of Jerusalem rebellious with a perpetual rebellion? They hold fast deceit; they refuse to return.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hearkened and heard, but they did not speak aright: there was no man that repented of his wickedness, saying, What have I done? each one returned to his course as the horse rushes into the battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even the stork in the heaven knows her appointed time; and the turtle dove and the crane and the swallow observe the time of their coming; but my people did not know the judgment of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: How do ye say, We are wise, and the law of the LORD is with us? Behold, certainly in vain did he make the pen; the scribes were in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wise men are ashamed, they are dismayed and taken: behold, they have rejected the word of the LORD; and what wisdom is in them?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will give their wives unto others and their fields unto those that shall inherit them: for each one from the least even unto the greatest is given to greed; from the prophet even unto the priest every one deals falsely.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they have treated the destruction of the daughter of my people lightly, saying, Peace, peace, when there is no peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? No, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore they shall fall among those that should fall: when I visit them, they shall fall, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will surely cut them off completely, said the LORD: there are no grapes on the vine, nor figs on the fig tree, and the leaf shall fall; and the things that I have given them shall pass away from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Upon what shall we secure ourselves? Assemble yourselves, and let us enter into the defenced cities, and let us be silent there: for the LORD our God has put us to silence and given us water of gall to drink because we have sinned against the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of health, and behold trouble!
speaker: Narrator

text: The snorting of his horses was heard from Dan; the whole earth trembled at the sound of the neighing of his strong ones; for they are come and have devoured the land and all that is in it, the city and those that dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, I send serpents, cockatrices, among you, which will not be charmed, and they shall bite you, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of my strong sorrow, my heart is faint in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold the voice of the cry of the daughter of my people that comes from a far country: Is not the LORD in Zion? Is not her king in her? Why have they provoked me to anger with their graven images and with vanities of a strange god?
speaker: Narrator

text: The harvest is past, the summer is ended, and we are not saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the destruction of the daughter of my people I am devastated; I am in darkness; astonishment has taken hold on me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is there no balm in Gilead; is there no physician there? Why then was there no medicine for the daughter of my people?
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that my head were waters and my eyes a fountain of tears that I might weep day and night for the slain of the daughter of my people!
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that I had in the wilderness a lodging place of wayfaring men that I might leave my people and go from them! for they are all adulterers, a congregation of rebels.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they bend their tongues like their bow for lies, but they are not valiant for the truth upon the earth for they proceed from evil to evil, and they did not recognize me, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take heed each one of his neighbour, and trust ye not in any brother: for every brother will utterly supplant, and every neighbour will walk with slanders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will deceive each one his neighbour and will not speak the truth: they have taught their tongue to speak lies and weary themselves to commit iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine habitation is in the midst of deceit; through deceit they refuse to know me, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus hath the LORD of the hosts said, Behold, I will melt them and try them; for how shall I do for the daughter of my people?
speaker: Narrator

text: Their tongue is as a sharp arrow; it speaks deceit: one speaks peaceably to his neighbour with his mouth but in heart he lays in wait.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall I not visit them for these things? saith the LORD; shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
speaker: Narrator

text: Upon the mountains I will lift up weeping and wailing and lamentation upon the habitations of the wilderness because they are burned up, so that no one can pass through them; neither can men hear the voice of the cattle; both the fowl of the heavens and even the beasts of the earth are fled; they are gone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make Jerusalem heaps and a den of dragons; and I will make the cities of Judah desolate, without an inhabitant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is the wise man that may understand this? and who is he to whom the mouth of the LORD has spoken that he may declare for what cause the land perishes and is burned up like a wilderness that no one passes through?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said, Because they have forsaken my law, which I set before them, and have not heard my voice, neither walked therein,
speaker: Narrator

text: but have walked after the imagination of their own heart and after the Baalim, which their fathers taught them,
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus hath the LORD of the hosts the God of Israel said: Behold, I will feed them, even this people, with wormwood and give them water of gall to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will scatter them also among Gentiles whom neither they nor their fathers have known, and I will send a sword after them until I have consumed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD of the hosts said, Consider ye and call for the mourning women that they may come and send for cunning women that they may come,
speaker: Narrator

text: and let them make haste and take up a wailing for us that our eyes may run down with tears and our eyelids gush out with waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion, How are we destroyed! We are greatly confounded. Why have we forsaken the land? Why have our dwellings cast us out?
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet hear the word of the LORD, O ye women, and let your ear receive the word of his mouth and teach your daughters wailing and each one her neighbour lamentation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For death is come up into our windows and is entered into our palaces to cut off the children from without and the young men from the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak, Thus hath the LORD said, Even the carcasses of men shall fall as dung upon the open field and as the handful after the harvestman, and there shall be none to gather them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD said, Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the mighty man glory in his might, let not the rich man glory in his riches;
speaker: Narrator

text: but let him that glories glory in this, that he understands me and knows me, that I am the LORD who does mercy, judgment, and righteousness in the earth: for in these things I delight, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will visit all those who are circumcised with the uncircumcised:
speaker: Narrator

text: Egypt and Judah and Edom and the sons of Ammon and Moab and all that are in the utmost corners, that dwell in the wilderness: for all the Gentiles are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear ye the word which the LORD has spoken over you, O house of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD said, Do not learn the way of the Gentiles, and do not fear the signs of heaven, even though the Gentiles fear them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the customs of the peoples are vanity: for one cuts a tree out of the forest, the work of the hands of the workman, with the axe.
speaker: Narrator

text: They deck it with silver and with gold; they fasten it with hammer and nails, that it not move.
speaker: Narrator

text: They compare them to the palm tree, and they do not speak: they must be carried, because they cannot walk. Do not be afraid of them; for they cannot do evil, neither do they have power to do good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forasmuch as there is none like unto thee, O LORD; thou art great, and thy name is great in might.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who would not fear thee, O King of the Gentiles? for unto thee does it appertain: forasmuch as among all the wise men of the Gentiles and in all their kingdoms, there is none like unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they shall become altogether carnal and foolish. The stock is a doctrine of vanities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Silver spread into plates shall be brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, shall the workman work and the hands of the founder: they shall dress them in blue and purple: they are all the work of cunning men.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the LORD God is the Truth, he himself is Living God and Everlasting King: at his wrath the earth trembles, and the Gentiles shall not be able to abide his indignation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus shall ye say unto them, The gods that have not made the heavens or the earth, even they shall perish from the earth and from under these heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that makes the earth by his power, he that orders the world with his wisdom and extends the heavens with his intelligence:
speaker: Narrator

text: at his voice, there is given a multitude of waters in the heavens, and he causes the clouds to ascend from the ends of the earth; he makes the lightnings with the rain and brings forth the wind out of his treasures.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every man is carnal in his knowledge: let every founder be ashamed of his graven image: for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no spirit in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are vanity and the work of scorn: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: The portion of Jacob is not like them: for he is the Former of all things, and Israel is the rod of his inheritance: The LORD of the hosts is his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gather up thy wares out of the lands, O inhabitant of the fortress.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus hath the LORD said, Behold, that this time I will throw out the inhabitants of the land with a sling and will afflict them, that they may find it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe is me for my hurt! my wound is grievous, but I said, Truly this is my sickness, and I must bear it.
speaker: Narrator

text: My tent is destroyed, and all my cords are broken: my sons were taken from me, and they are lost; there is no one to stretch forth my tent any more and to set up my curtains.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the pastors are become carnal and have not sought the LORD; therefore they did not understand, and all their flocks scattered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the voice of the rumour is come, and a great commotion out of the land of the north wind to make the cities of Judah desolate and a den of dragons.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD, I know that man is not the lord of his own way: it is not in man that walks to order his steps.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD, chastise me, but with judgment; not with thine anger lest thou bring me to nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pour out thy fury upon the Gentiles that do not know thee and upon the nations that do not call on thy name: for they have eaten up Jacob and devoured him and consumed him and have destroyed his habitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear ye the words of this covenant, and speak unto every man of Judah and to every inhabitant of Jerusalem;
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou shalt say unto them, Thus hath the LORD God of Israel said: Cursed be the man that does not hear the words of this covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text: which I commanded your fathers the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, from the iron furnace, saying unto them, hear my voice and comply with my words according to all which I command you; and ye shall be my people, and I will be your God
speaker: Narrator

text: that I may confirm the oath which I have sworn unto your fathers, that I would give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as it is this day. Then I answered, and said, Amen, O LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto me, Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, Hear ye the words of this covenant and do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I earnestly protested unto your fathers in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, even unto this day, rising early and protesting, saying, Hear my voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they did not hear, nor did they incline their ear, but walked each one in the imagination of their evil heart; therefore I will bring upon them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do; but they did them not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto me, A conspiracy is found among the men of Judah and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have returned to the iniquities of their first fathers, who refused to hear my words; and they went after other gods to serve them: the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken my covenant which I made with their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus hath the LORD said, Behold, I will bring evil upon them, which they shall not be able to escape; and though they shall cry unto me, I will not hearken unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall the cities of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem go and cry unto the gods unto whom they offer incense, who shall not be able to save them in the time of their trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: For according to the number of thy cities were thy gods, O Judah; and according to the number of thy streets, O Jerusalem, have ye set up altars of confusion, even altars to burn incense unto Baal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up a cry or prayer for them for I will not hear them in the time that they cry unto me in their trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: What part has my beloved in my house, seeing she has wrought lewdness with many? The holy flesh shall pass from upon thee, for in thy evil thou didst glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD called thy name, A green olive tree, beautiful in fruit and in appearance. At the voice of a great word he caused fire to be kindled upon it, and they broke her branches.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD of the hosts, that planted thee, has pronounced evil against thee for the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have done against themselves to provoke me to anger in offering incense unto Baal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD gave me knowledge of it, and I experienced it: then thou didst show me their doings.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I was like a ram or an ox that is brought to the slaughter; for I did not understand that they had devised devices against me, saying, Let us destroy the tree with its fruit, and let us cut him off from the land of the living that his name may no longer be remembered.
speaker: Narrator

text: But, O LORD of the hosts, that judges righteously, that tries the kidneys and the heart, let me see thy vengeance on them, for unto thee I have uncovered my cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, thus hath the LORD said regarding the men of Anathoth that seek thy life, saying, Do not prophesy in the name of the LORD that thou not die by our hand;
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore, thus hath the LORD of the hosts said, Behold, I visit: the young men shall die by the sword; their sons and their daughters shall die by famine:
speaker: Narrator

text: and there shall be no remnant of them: for I will bring evil upon the men of Anathoth, even the year of their visitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteous art thou, O LORD, even though I dispute with thee: even so, I will speak judgments with thee; Why does the way of the wicked prosper? All those that completely rebel against thee have peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast planted them, and they have taken root: they grow, and they bring forth fruit; thou art near in their mouth and far from their kidneys.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, O LORD, dost know me; thou hast seen me and tried my heart toward thee; pull them out like sheep for the slaughter, and mark them for the day of slaughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long shall the land be desolate, and the grass of all the field wither, for the wickedness of those that dwell therein? The cattle are lacking, and the birds, because they said, He shall not see our latter end.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou hast run with the footmen, and they have wearied thee then how canst thou contend with horses? and if in the land of peace, in which thou didst trust, they wearied thee, then how wilt thou do in the swelling of Jordan?
speaker: Narrator

text: For even thy brethren, and the house of thy father, even they have dealt treacherously with thee, even they have raised their voice after thee, O congregation; do not believe them, when they speak fair words unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have forsaken my house, I have left my heritage; I have given the dearly beloved of my soul into the hand of her enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heritage was unto me as a lion in the forest; it cried out against me, therefore I have hated it.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heritage is unto me as a speckled bird; the birds round about are against her; come ye, assemble all the beasts of the field, come to devour her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many pastors have destroyed my vineyard; they have trodden my heritage under foot; they have made my precious heritage a desolate wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have made it desolate; it cries against me, desolate; the whole land was made desolate because there was no man that would see.
speaker: Narrator

text: The spoilers are come upon all high places through the wilderness: for the sword of the LORD shall devour from the one end of the land even to the other end of the land; there is no peace for any flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have sown bread, but shall reap thorns; they had the heritage, but they did not profit; and they shall be ashamed because of your fruits, by the fierce anger of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD said against all my evil neighbours that touch the heritage which I have caused my people Israel to inherit; Behold, I will pluck them out of their land and pluck out the house of Judah from among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass that after I have plucked them out, I will return and have mercy on them, and will cause them to return, each one to his heritage, and each one to his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently learn the ways of my people, to swear in my name, saying, The LORD lives; as they taught my people to swear by Baal then they shall be prospered in the midst of my people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if they will not hear, I will utterly pluck up and destroy that nation, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD said unto me, Go and buy thee a linen girdle and put it upon thy loins, and thou shalt not put it in water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I bought the girdle according to the word of the LORD and put it on my loins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the LORD came unto me the second time, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the girdle that thou hast bought, which is upon thy loins, and arise; go to the Euphrates and hide it there in a hole of the rock.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I went and hid it in the Euphrates, as the LORD commanded me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass after many days that the LORD said unto me, Arise; go to the Euphrates and take from there the girdle, which I commanded thee to hide there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I went to the Euphrates and dug and took the girdle from the place where I had hid it; and, behold, the girdle was rotted, it was good for nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD said, After this manner I will cause the pride of Judah to rot and the great pride of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: This evil people that refuses to hear my words, which walk in the imagination of their heart and went after other gods to serve them and to worship them shall even be as this girdle, which is good for nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as the girdle cleaves to the loins of a man, so I have caused to cleave unto me the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah, saith the LORD; that they might be unto me for a people and for fame, and for a praise, and for honour; but they did not hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou shalt speak unto them this word: Thus hath the LORD God of Israel said, Every bottle shall be filled with wine; and they shall say unto thee, Do we not certainly know that every bottle shall be filled with wine?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou say unto them, Thus hath the LORD said, Behold, I fill all the inhabitants of this land with drunkenness, even the kings that sit upon David’s throne and the priests and the prophets and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will break them one against another, even the fathers with the sons together, saith the LORD; I will not pity nor spare nor have mercy to not destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear ye and give ear; do not be proud: for the LORD has spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give glory to the LORD your God before he causes darkness and before your feet stumble in mountains of darkness, and while ye look for light, he turns it into the shadow of death and makes it gross darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye will not hear this, my soul shall weep in secret because of your pride; and weeping bitterly, my eyes shall be undone in tears because the LORD’s flock was carried away captive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say unto the king and to the queen, Humble yourselves, sit down in the dust because the crown of your glory has come down off your heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities of the south were shut up, and no one could open them: Judah was carried away captive; all of it, it was completely carried away captive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your eyes, and behold those that come from the north wind: where is the flock that was given thee, the cattle of thy beauty?
speaker: Narrator

text: What wilt thou say when he shall visit thee? For thou hast taught them to be princes and as head over thee; shall not sorrows take thee as a woman in travail?
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou shalt say in thine heart, Why do these things come upon me? For the greatness of thine iniquity are thy skirts discovered and thy heels made bare.
speaker: Narrator

text: Can the Ethiopian change his skin or the leopard his spots? Likewise ye also cannot do good, being taught to do evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will scatter them as the stubble that passes away by the wind of the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: This shall be thy lot, the portion of thy measures from me said the LORD; because thou hast forgotten me, and trusted in falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I uncovered thy skirts before thy face, and thy shame was manifested.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have seen thine adulteries and thy neighings, the lewdness of thy whoredom upon the hills; in the same field I saw thine abominations. Woe unto thee, O Jerusalem! wilt thou not be made clean at last? How long then shall it be?
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the LORD that was given to Jeremiah concerning the famine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judah mourns, and its gates languish; they are black unto the ground; and the cry of Jerusalem is gone up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their nobles have sent their little ones to the waters: they came to the pits and found no water; they returned with their vessels empty; they were ashamed and confounded and covered their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because the ground is chapped, for there was no rain in the earth, the plowmen were ashamed, they covered their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even the hind calved in the field and forsook it, because there was no grass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the wild asses stood in the high places, they snuffed up the wind like dragons; their eyes failed because there was no grass.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD, though our iniquities testify against us, do it for thy name’s sake; for our rebellions have multiplied; we have sinned against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the hope of Israel, the Keeper thereof in time of trouble, why should thou be as a stranger in the land and as a wayfaring man that turns aside to tarry for a night?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why should thou be as a speechless man as a mighty man that cannot save? Yet thou, O LORD, art in the midst of us, and we are called by thy name; do not leave us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD said unto this people, Thus have they loved to move, nor have they refrained their feet; therefore the LORD does not have them in his will; he will now remember their iniquity and visit their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto me, Do not pray for this people for their good.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer burnt offering and an oblation, I will not accept them; but I will consume them by sword and by famine and by pestilence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said, Ah, Lord GOD! behold, the prophets say unto them, Ye shall not see the sword, neither shall ye have famine; but I will give you true peace in this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto me, The prophets prophesy lies in my name: I did not send them, neither have I commanded them, neither did I speak unto them: they prophesy unto you a false vision, divination, vanity, and the deceit of their heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus hath the LORD said concerning the prophets that prophesy in my name which I did not send and that say, Sword and famine shall not be in this land; By sword and famine shall those prophets be consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people to whom they prophesy shall be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword; and they shall have no one to bury them, their wives, nor their sons, nor their daughters; for I will pour their wickedness upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou shalt say this word unto them: Let my eyes run down with tears night and day, and let them not cease, for the virgin daughter of my people is broken with a great breach, with a very grievous blow.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I go forth into the field, then behold the slain with the sword! and if I enter into the city, then behold those that are sick with famine! for both the prophet and the priest walked around in circles in the land, and they did not know it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hast thou utterly rejected Judah? Hath thy soul loathed Zion? Why didst thou cause us to be smitten when no healing remains for us? We waited for peace, and there was no good; and for the time of healing, and behold trouble!
speaker: Narrator

text: We acknowledge, O LORD, our wickedness, and the iniquity of our fathers; for we have sinned against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not cast us away; for thy name’s sake, do not disgrace the throne of thy glory; remember, do not break thy covenant with us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Are there any among the vanities of the Gentiles that can cause it to rain? or can the heavens give rain? art not thou he, O LORD our God? therefore we will wait upon thee, for thou hast made all these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my will would not be toward this people: cast them out of my sight, and let them go forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, if they say unto thee, Where shall we go forth? then thou shalt tell them, Thus hath the LORD said: Such as are for death, to death; and such as are for the sword, to the sword; and such as are for the famine, to the famine; and such as are for the captivity, to the captivity.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will visit over them four kinds of evil, saith the LORD: the sword to slay, and the dogs to tear, and the fowls of the heaven and the beasts of the earth to devour and destroy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will give them over to be sifted by all the kingdoms of the earth because of Manasseh, the son of Hezekiah king of Judah, for that which he did in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who shall have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem? or who shall bemoan thee? or who is to come to ask regarding thy peace?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast forsaken me, saith the LORD; thou art gone backward: therefore, I stretched out my hand over thee and cast thee away; I am tired of repenting.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I fanned them with a fan unto the gates of the land; I bereaved them of children, I wasted my people; they did not turn from their ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their widows are multiplied unto me more than the sand of the sea: I have brought upon them a destroyer at noonday against the young; I have caused him to fall upon her suddenly, and terrors upon the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: She that has borne seven languishes; her soul is filled with sorrow; her sun is gone down while it was yet day; she has been ashamed and confounded; and the residue of them I will deliver to the sword before their enemies, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe is me, my mother, that thou hast borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have neither lent on usury, nor men have lent to me on usury; yet every one of them curses me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD said, Verily it shall be well with thy remnant; verily I will cause the enemy to entreat thee well in the time of evil and in the time of affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall iron break the iron from the place of the north wind and the bronze?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy riches and thy treasures I will give to the spoil without price, and that for all thy sins, even in all thy borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make thee to serve thine enemies in a land which thou dost not know; for a fire is kindled in my anger, which shall burn upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD, thou knowest: remember me and visit me and revenge me of my enemies; do not take me away in the prolongation of thy anger, know that for thy sake I have suffered rebuke.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy words were found, and I ate them; and thy word was unto me the joy and rejoicing of my heart: for thy name was called upon me, O LORD God of the hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: I did not sit in the assembly of the mockers, nor did I become puffed up by reason of thy prophecy; I sat alone because thou hast filled me with indignation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why was my pain perpetual and my wound incurable, which refuses to be healed? Wilt thou be altogether unto me as a liar and as waters that fail?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus hath the LORD said, If thou wilt return, then I will bring thee again, and thou shalt stand before me; and if thou wilt take forth the precious from the vile, thou shalt be as my mouth; let them return unto thee, but return not thou unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will give thee unto this people as a fenced brazen wall, and they shall fight against thee but they shall not prevail against thee: for I am with thee to keep thee and to defend thee, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked, and I will ransom thee out of the hand of the strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not take thee a wife, neither shalt thou have sons or daughters in this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus hath the LORD said concerning the sons and concerning the daughters that would be born in this place and concerning their mothers that would bare them and concerning their fathers that would beget them in this land
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall die of grievous deaths; they shall not be lamented; neither shall they be buried; but they shall be as dung upon the face of the earth; and they shall be consumed by the sword and by famine; and their carcasses shall be food for the fowls of heaven and for the beasts of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus hath the LORD said, Do not enter into the house of mourning, neither go to lament nor comfort them: for I have taken away my peace from this people, said the LORD, even mercy and compassion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Both the great and the small shall die in this land: they shall not be buried, neither shall men lament for them, nor cut themselves, nor make themselves bald for them:
speaker: Narrator

text: neither shall they break the bread of mourning for them, to comfort themselves for their death; neither shall men give them the cup of consolation to drink for their father or for their mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same manner thou shalt not go into the house of feasting, to sit with them to eat and to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus hath the LORD of the hosts, the God of Israel said: Behold, I will cause to cease in this place before your eyes and in your days, every voice of mirth and every voice of gladness, every voice of the bridegroom, and every voice of the bride.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, when thou shalt show this people all these things, they shall say unto thee, Why has the LORD pronounced all this great evil against us? or what is our iniquity? or what is our sin which we have committed against the LORD our God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt say unto them, Because your fathers have forsaken me, saith the LORD, and have walked after other gods and have served them and have worshipped them, and have forsaken me and have not kept my law;
speaker: Narrator

text: and ye have done worse than your fathers; for, behold, ye walk each one after the imagination of his evil heart, not hearkening unto me:
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will cause you to be cast out of this land into a land that ye do not know, neither ye nor your fathers; and there ye shall serve other gods day and night; for I will not grant you mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, behold, the days come, said the LORD, that it shall no longer be said, The LORD lives, that caused the sons of Israel to come up out of the land of Egypt;
speaker: Narrator

text: but, The LORD lives, that caused the sons of Israel to come up out of the land of the north wind, and from all the lands where he had driven them; and I will bring them again into their land that I gave unto their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I send many fishers, saith the LORD, and they shall fish them; and after, will I send many hunters, and they shall hunt them from every mountain and from every hill, and out of the holes of the rocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my eyes are upon all their ways, which they have not hid from me, neither does their iniquity hide from the presence of my eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But first I will recompense their iniquity and their sin double because they have defiled my land with the carcasses of their abominations, and they have filled my inheritance with abominable things.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD, my strength, and my fortress, and my refuge in the time of the affliction; Gentiles shall come unto thee from the ends of the earth and shall say, Surely our fathers have inherited lies, vanity, and things in which there is no profit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall a man make gods unto himself? But they shall not be gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, behold, I will cause them to know this time; I will cause them to know my hand and my might; and they shall know that my name is The LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron and with the point of a diamond; it is graven upon the table of their heart and upon the horns of your altars
speaker: Narrator

text: that their sons might remember their altars and their groves, by the green trees and upon the high hills.
speaker: Narrator

text: My mountain dweller! In the field are thy riches; all thy treasures I will give to the spoil, because of the sin of thy high places throughout all thy borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou, even thyself, shalt discontinue from thine heritage that I gave thee; and I will cause thee to serve thine enemies in the land which thou dost not know: for ye have kindled a fire in my anger, which shall burn for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD said; Cursed be the man that trusts in man and makes flesh his arm and whose heart departs from the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he shall be like the heath in the desert and shall not see when good comes, but shall inhabit the parched places in the wilderness, in a salt land and not inhabited.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man that is steadfast in the LORD and whose trust is the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he shall be as a tree planted by the waters, that spreads out her roots by the river and shall not see when heat comes, but her leaf shall be green and shall not be fatigued in the year of drought, neither shall cease from yielding fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heart is deceitful above all things and desperately wicked; who shall know it?
speaker: Narrator

text: I the LORD search the heart; I try the kidneys, even to give each man according to his ways and according to the fruit of his doings.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the partridge that steals that which she did not hatch, is he that gets riches and not with righteousness; in the midst of his days he shall leave them, and at his end shall be a fool.
speaker: Narrator

text: The throne of glory, height from the beginning, is the place of our sanctification.
speaker: Narrator

text: O hope of Israel! LORD, all that forsake thee shall be ashamed; and those that depart from me shall be written in the dust because they have forsaken the LORD, the fountain of living waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heal me, O LORD, and I shall be healed; save me, and I shall be saved: for thou art my praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, they say unto me, Where is the word of the LORD? let it come now.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I did not take it upon myself to be a pastor following thee; neither have I desired the woeful day; thou dost know: that which came out of my lips has come forth in thy presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be a terror unto me; thou art my hope in the day of evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be confounded that persecute me, but do not let me be confounded; let them be dismayed; but do not let me be dismayed: bring upon them the day of evil and destroy them with double destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus said the LORD unto me: Go and stand in the gate of the sons of the people by which the kings of Judah come in and by which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem;
speaker: Narrator

text: and say unto them, Hear ye the word of the LORD, ye kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, that enter in by these gates:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD said: Take heed for your lives, and bring no burden on the sabbath day to bring it in by the gates of Jerusalem;
speaker: Narrator

text: neither carry forth a burden out of your houses on the sabbath day, neither do any work, but sanctify the sabbath day, as I commanded your fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: who did not hear, nor inclined their ear, but made their neck stiff, that they might not hear, nor receive correction.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, if ye diligently hearken unto me, saith the LORD, to bring in no burden through the gates of this city on the sabbath day but sanctify the sabbath day to do no work therein,
speaker: Narrator

text: then shall there enter in by the gates of this city, the kings and the princes, who sit upon the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, they, and their princes, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem: and this city shall be inhabited for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall come from the cities of Judah and from the places about Jerusalem and from the land of Benjamin and from the fields and from the mountain and from the south, bringing burnt offerings and sacrifices and presents and incense, and bringing the sacrifice of praise unto the house of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye will not hearken unto me to sanctify the sabbath day, and not to bring burdens nor bring it in through the gates of Jerusalem on the sabbath day; then I will kindle a fire in the gates thereof, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem, and it shall not be quenched.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise and go down to the potter’s house, and there I will cause thee to hear my words.
speaker: Narrator
