text: And Zedekiah the king said unto Jeremiah, I am afraid of the Jews that are fallen to the Chaldeans, lest they deliver me into their hand, and they mock me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jeremiah said, They shall not deliver thee. Hear now the voice of the LORD, which I speak unto thee: so it shall be well unto thee, and thy soul shall live.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if thou refuse to go forth, this is the word that the LORD hath showed me:
speaker: Narrator

text: and, behold, all the women that are left in the king of Judah’s house shall be brought forth to the king of Babylon’s princes, and those women shall say, Thy friends have deceived thee and have prevailed against thee; thy feet are sunk in the mire, and they are turned away back.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they shall bring out all thy wives and thy children to the Chaldeans; and thou shalt not escape out of their hand but shalt be taken by the hand of the king of Babylon; and thou shalt cause this city to be burned with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Zedekiah unto Jeremiah, Let no man know of these words, and thou shalt not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the princes hear that I have talked with thee, and they come unto thee, and say unto thee, Declare unto us now what thou hast said unto the king, hide it not from us, and we will not put thee to death; also what the king said unto thee:
speaker: Narrator

text: then thou shalt say unto them, I presented my supplication before the king, that he would not cause me to return to Jonathan’s house, to die there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the princes came unto Jeremiah, and asked him: and he told them according to all those words that the king had commanded. So they left off speaking with him; for the matter was not perceived.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jeremiah abode in the court of the guard until the day that Jerusalem was taken; and he was there when Jerusalem was taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon and all his army came against Jerusalem, and they besieged it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, the ninth day of the month, the city was broken up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the princes of the king of Babylon came in, and sat in the middle gate even Nergalsharezer, Samgarnebo, Sarsechim, Rabsaris, Nergalsharezer, Rabmag, with all the residue of the princes of the king of Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, that when Zedekiah the king of Judah saw them and all the men of war, then they fled and went forth out of the city by night, by the way of the king’s garden, by the gate between the two walls; and the king went out by the way of the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Chaldeans’ army pursued after them, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho; and when they had taken him, they brought him up to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath, where he sentenced him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah in Riblah before his eyes; also the king of Babylon slew all the nobles of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover he put out Zedekiah’s eyes and bound him with chains, to carry him to Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Chaldeans burned the king’s house and the houses of the people with fire and broke down the walls of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive into Babylon the remnant of the people that remained in the city, and those that had come over to him, with the rest of the people that remained.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poor of the people, which had nothing, in the land of Judah, and gave them vineyards and fields at the same time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon gave charge concerning Jeremiah to Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Take him, and look well to him and do him no harm; but do unto him even as he shall say unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard sent, and Nebushasban, Rabsaris, and Nergalsharezer, Rabmag, and all the king of Babylon’s princes;
speaker: Narrator

text: even they sent, and took Jeremiah out of the court of the guard, and committed him unto Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan, that he should carry him home: so he dwelt among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the word of the LORD had come unto Jeremiah, while he was shut up in the court of the prison, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Go and speak to Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, saying, Thus hath the LORD of the hosts, the God of Israel said: Behold, I will bring my words upon this city for evil, and not for good; and they shall be accomplished in that day before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will deliver thee in that day, said the LORD, and thou shalt not be given into the hand of the men of whom thou art afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will surely deliver thee, and thou shalt not fall by the sword, but thy life shall be for a prey unto thee, because thou hast put thy trust in me, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, after Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had let him go from Ramah, when he had taken him being bound in chains among all that were carried away captive of Jerusalem and Judah, which were carried away captive unto Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the captain of the guard took Jeremiah, and said unto him, The LORD thy God has pronounced this evil upon this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the LORD has brought it and done according as he had said; because ye have sinned against the LORD, and did not listen to his voice, therefore this thing is come upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, behold, I loose thee this day from the chains which were upon thine hand. If it seems good unto thee to come with me into Babylon, come; and I will look well unto thee: but if it seems ill unto thee to come with me into Babylon, forbear: behold, all the land is before thee; where it seems good and convenient for thee to go, go there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now while he had not yet replied that he would go back, the captain said, Go back also to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon has made governor over the cities of Judah and dwell with him among the people, or go wherever it seems convenient unto thee to go. So the captain of the guard gave him victuals and a reward and sent him forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jeremiah came unto Gedaliah the son of Ahikam to Mizpah and dwelt with him among the people that were left in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the princes of the army which were in the field, even they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam governor over the land and had committed unto him the men and the women and the children and the poor of the land, those that were not carried away captive to Babylon;
speaker: Narrator

text: then they came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan and Jonathan the sons of Kareah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth, and the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah the son of a Maachathite, they and their men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan swore unto them and to their men, saying, Fear not to serve the Chaldeans; dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon, and it shall be well with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for me, behold, I dwell in Mizpah to serve the Chaldeans, which will come unto us; but ye, gather ye the wine and the bread and the oil and put them in your vessels and dwell in your cities that ye have taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise when all the Jews that were in Moab and among the Ammonites and in Edom and that were in all the lands heard how the king of Babylon had left a remnant in Judah and that he had set over them Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan,
speaker: Narrator

text: all these Jews returned out of all places where they were driven and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah in Mizpah, and gathered wine and much fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover Johanan the son of Kareah and all the princes of the armies that were in the fields came to Gedaliah to Mizpah
speaker: Narrator

text: and said unto him, Dost thou certainly know that Baalis the king of the Ammonites has sent Ishmael the son of Nethaniah to slay thee? But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam did not believe them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Johanan the son of Kareah spoke to Gedaliah in Mizpah secretly, saying, I will go now, and I will slay Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and no man shall know it; why should he slay thee, that all the Jews which are gathered unto thee should be scattered and the remnant in Judah perish?
speaker: Narrator

text: But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam said unto Johanan the son of Kareah, Thou shalt not do this thing, for thou dost speak falsely of Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it came to pass in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah the son of Elishama, of the royal seed, and some princes of the king, and ten men with him, came unto Gedaliah the son of Ahikam in Mizpah; and there they ate bread together in Mizpah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then arose Ishmael the son of Nethaniah and the ten men that were with him, and smote Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan with the sword and slew him whom the king of Babylon had made governor over the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishmael also slew all the Jews that were with him, even with Gedaliah at Mizpah and the Chaldean soldiers that were found there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass the second day after he had slain Gedaliah, when no one knew of it yet
speaker: Narrator

text: that there came certain men of Shechem, of Shiloh, and of Samaria, eighty men, having their beards shaven, and their clothes rent, and having cut themselves, with offerings and incense in their hand, to bring them to the house of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ishmael the son of Nethaniah went forth from Mizpah to meet them, weeping all along as he went: and it came to pass, as he met them, he said unto them, Come to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was so, when they came into the midst of the city, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah slew them and cast them into the midst of a pit, he, and the men that were with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ten men were found among them that said unto Ishmael, Slay us not: for we have treasures in the field, of wheat and of barley and of oil and of honey. So he forbare, and did not slay them among their brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the pit in which Ishmael had cast all the dead bodies of the men, whom he had slain because of Gedaliah, was the same which Asa the king had made for fear of Baasha king of Israel: and Ishmael the son of Nethaniah filled it with those that were slain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Ishmael carried away captive all the residue of the people that were in Mizpah, even the king’s daughters and all the people that remained in Mizpah, whom Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had committed to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam: and Ishmael the son of Nethaniah carried them away captive and departed to go over to the Ammonites.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the princes of the armies that were with him, heard of all the evil that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had done,
speaker: Narrator

text: then they took all the men and went to fight with Ishmael the son of Nethaniah and found him by the great waters that are in Gibeon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it came to pass, that when all the people which were with Ishmael heard Johanan the son of Kareah and all the princes of the armies that were with him, then they were glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the people that Ishmael had carried away captive from Mizpah cast about and returned and went unto Johanan the son of Kareah.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Ishmael the son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men and went to the Ammonites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the princes of the armies that were with him, took all the remnant of the people which had turned from Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, from Mizpah, after he had slain Gedaliah the son of Ahikam; men of war, and the women, and the children, and the eunuchs, whom Johanan had caused to turn from Gibeon:
speaker: Narrator

text: and they departed and dwelt in the habitation of Chimham, which is by Bethlehem, that they might go and enter into Egypt
speaker: Narrator

text: because of the Chaldeans; for they were afraid of them, because Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had slain Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon made governor in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the princes of the armies, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least even unto the greatest, came near,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said unto Jeremiah the prophet, Let, we beseech thee, our supplication be accepted before thee, and pray for us unto the LORD thy God, even for all this remnant (for we are left but a few of many, as thine eyes do behold us)
speaker: Narrator

text: that the LORD thy God may show us the way in which we walk, and that which we should do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jeremiah the prophet said unto them, I have heard you; behold, I will pray unto the LORD your God according to your words; and it shall come to pass, that whatever thing the LORD shall answer you, I will declare it unto you; I will keep nothing back from you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said to Jeremiah, The LORD be a true and faithful witness between us, if we do not even according to all things for the which the LORD thy God shall send thee to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whether it be good, or whether it be evil, we will hear the voice of the LORD our God, to whom we send thee; that, obeying the voice of the LORD our God, it may be well with us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass after ten days, that the word of the LORD came unto Jeremiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he called Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the princes of the armies which were with him, and all the people from the least even to the greatest,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said unto them, Thus hath the LORD, the God of Israel said, unto whom ye sent me to present your supplication before him,
speaker: Narrator

text: If ye will still abide in this land, then I will build you, and not pull you down, and I will plant you, and not pluck you up; for I repent of the evil that I have done unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be afraid of the king of Babylon, of whom ye are afraid; do not be afraid of him, said the LORD: for I am with you to save you and to deliver you from his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will show mercies unto you, that he may have mercy upon you and cause you to dwell in your own land.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye say, We will not dwell in this land, not listening to the voice of the LORD your God,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, No, but we will go into the land of Egypt, where we shall see no war, nor hear the sound of the shofar, nor have hunger of bread; and there we will dwell:
speaker: Narrator

text: and now therefore hear the word of the LORD, ye remnant of Judah; thus hath the LORD of the hosts, the God of Israel said: If ye altogether set your faces to enter into Egypt, and go to sojourn there;
speaker: Narrator

text: then it shall come to pass that the sword, which ye feared, shall overtake you there in the land of Egypt, and the famine, of which ye were afraid, shall follow close after you there in Egypt; and there ye shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall it be with all the men that set their faces to go into Egypt to sojourn there; they shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence; and none of them shall remain or escape from the evil that I will bring upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus hath the LORD of the hosts, the God of Israel said: As my anger and my fury have been poured forth upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so shall my fury be poured forth upon you when ye shall enter into Egypt, and ye shall be an execration and an astonishment and a curse and a reproach; and ye shall see this place no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD hath said concerning you, O ye remnant of Judah. Do not go into Egypt; know certainly that I have admonished you this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why did ye cause your souls to err? For ye sent me unto the LORD your God, saying, Pray for us unto the LORD our God; and according unto all that the LORD our God shall say, so declare unto us, and we will do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now I have this day declared it to you, but ye have not obeyed the voice of the LORD your God, nor any thing for which he has sent me unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore know certainly that ye shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, in the place where ye desire to go and to sojourn.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, that when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking unto all the people all the words of the LORD their God, for which the LORD their God had sent him to them, even all these words,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then spoke Azariah the son of Hoshaiah, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the proud men, saying unto Jeremiah, Thou dost speak falsely; the LORD our God has not sent thee to say, Do not go into Egypt to sojourn there:
speaker: Narrator

text: but Baruch the son of Neriah sets thee on against us, to deliver us into the hand of the Chaldeans, that they might put us to death and carry us away captives into Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Johanan the son of Kareah and all the princes of the armies and all the people, did not hear the voice of the LORD, to dwell in the land of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the princes of the armies, took all the remnant of Judah, that had returned from among all the Gentiles, where they had been driven, to dwell in the land of Judah;
speaker: Narrator

text: men and women and children and the king’s daughters, and every soul that Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had left with Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan, and Jeremiah the prophet, and Baruch the son of Neriah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they left for the land of Egypt; because they did not listen to the voice of the LORD: thus they came even to Tahpanhes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the word of the LORD came unto Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Take great stones in thine hand and cover them with clay in a brickkiln, which is at the entry of Pharaoh’s house in Tahpanhes, in the sight of the men of Judah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and say unto them, Thus hath the LORD of the hosts, the God of Israel said; Behold, I will send and take Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon, my slave and will set his throne upon these stones that I have hid, and he shall spread his royal pavilion over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall come and smite the land of Egypt and deliver such as are for death to death; and such as are for captivity to captivity; and such as are for the sword to the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will put fire to the houses of the gods of Egypt; and he shall burn them and carry them away captives: and he shall array himself with the land of Egypt as a shepherd puts on his garment; and he shall go forth from there in peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall also break the images of Bethshemesh, that is in the land of Egypt; and the houses of the gods of the Egyptians shall he burn with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews which dwelt in the land of Egypt, which dwelt at Migdol and at Tahpanhes and at Noph and in the country of Pathros, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD of the hosts, the God of Israel said: Ye have seen all the evil that I have brought upon Jerusalem and upon all the cities of Judah; and, behold, this day they are a desolation, and no man dwells therein,
speaker: Narrator

text: because of their wickedness which they have committed to provoke me to anger, in that they went to burn incense and to serve other gods, whom they knew not, neither they, ye, nor your fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit I sent unto you all my slaves the prophets, rising early and sending them, saying, Oh, do not this abominable thing that I hate.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they did not hearken, nor incline their ear to turn from their wickedness, to burn no incense unto other gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore my fury and my anger was poured forth and was kindled in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem; and they are wasted and desolate, as at this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore now thus hath the LORD, the God of the hosts, the God of Israel said: Why do ye commit this great evil against your souls, that ye be cut off, man and woman, child and suckling, out of Judah. Why do ye not desire to have a remnant?
speaker: Narrator

text: In that ye provoke me unto wrath with the works of your hands, burning incense unto other gods in the land of Egypt, where ye are gone to dwell. Why do ye cut yourselves off that ye might be a curse and a reproach to all the Gentiles of the earth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Have ye forgotten the wickedness of your fathers, and the wickedness of the kings of Judah, and the wickedness of their wives, and your own wickedness, and the wickedness of your wives, which was committed in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
speaker: Narrator

text: They are not broken even unto this day, neither have they feared, nor walked in my law, nor in my rights, that I set before you and before your fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus hath the LORD of the hosts, the God of Israel said: Behold, I will set my face against you for evil and to cut off all Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will take the remnant of Judah that have set their faces to go into the land of Egypt to dwell there, and they shall all be consumed and fall in the land of Egypt; they shall even be consumed by the sword and by the famine; they shall die, from the least even unto the greatest, by the sword and by the famine; and they shall be for an oath and an astonishment and a curse and a reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will visit those that dwell in the land of Egypt as I visited Jerusalem with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence:
speaker: Narrator

text: so that none of the remnant of Judah, which are gone into the land of Egypt to dwell there, shall escape or remain alive to return into the land of Judah, unto which they have a desire to return to dwell there; for none shall return but some fugitives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the men who knew that their wives had burned incense unto other gods, and all the women that stood by, a great multitude, even all the people that dwelt in the land of Egypt, in Pathros, answered Jeremiah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the word that thou hast spoken unto us in the name of the LORD, we will not hearken unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we will certainly do whatsoever thing goes forth out of our own mouth to burn incense unto the queen of heaven and to pour out drink offerings unto her as we have done, we, and our fathers, our kings, and our princes, in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem; for then had we plenty of victuals, and were well, and saw no evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: But since we left off to burn incense to the queen of heaven and to pour out drink offerings unto her, we have lacked all things and have been consumed by the sword and by the famine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when we burned incense to the queen of heaven and poured out drink offerings unto her, did we make her cakes to worship her and pour out drink offerings unto her, without our men?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jeremiah said unto all the people, to the men, and to the women, and to all the people who had given him that answer, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: The incense that ye burned in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, ye, and your fathers, your kings, and your princes, and the people of the land, did not the LORD remember them and did it not come into his mind?
speaker: Narrator

text: So that the LORD could no longer bear because of the evil of your doings, and because of the abominations which ye have committed; therefore is your land a desolation and an astonishment and a curse, without an inhabitant, as at this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because ye have burned incense and because ye have sinned against the LORD and have not listened to the voice of the LORD nor walked in his law nor in his rights, nor in his testimonies; therefore this evil has come upon you, as at this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover Jeremiah said unto all the people, and to all the women, Hear the word of the LORD, all Judah that are in the land of Egypt:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath spoken the LORD of the hosts, the God of Israel, saying: Ye and your wives have both spoken with your mouths and fulfilled with your hand, saying, We will surely perform our vows that we have vowed, to burn incense to the queen of heaven and to pour out drink offerings unto her; ye will surely accomplish your vows and surely perform your vows.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore hear ye the word of the LORD, all Judah that dwell in the land of Egypt; Behold, I have sworn by my great name, said the LORD, that my name shall no more be named in the mouth of any man of Judah in all the land of Egypt, saying, The Lord GOD lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I will watch over them for evil, and not for good: and all the men of Judah that are in the land of Egypt shall be consumed by the sword and by the famine until there is an end of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet a small number that escape the sword shall return out of the land of Egypt into the land of Judah, so that all the remnant of Judah, that are gone into the land of Egypt to dwell there, shall know whose words shall stand, mine, or theirs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this shall be a sign unto you, saith the LORD, that I will visit you in this place, that ye may know that my words shall surely stand against you for evil:
speaker: Narrator

text: thus hath the LORD said: Behold, I will give Pharaohhophra king of Egypt into the hand of his enemies and into the hand of those that seek his soul; as I gave Zedekiah king of Judah into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, his enemy, and that sought his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word that Jeremiah the prophet spoke unto Baruch the son of Neriah, when he had written these words in a book at the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD, the God of Israel said unto thee, O Baruch:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst say, Woe is me now! for the LORD has added grief to my sorrow; I fainted in my sighing, and I have found no rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus shalt thou say unto him, The LORD said thus: Behold, I destroy those whom I have built up and those whom I have planted I pluck up, even this whole land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And dost thou seek great things for thyself? seek them not; for, behold, I bring evil upon all flesh, said the LORD: but I will give thee thy life as a spoil of battle in all places where thou goest.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the LORD which came to Jeremiah the prophet against the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Egypt: against the army of Pharaohnecho king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Order ye the buckler and shield, and draw near to battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Harness the horses; and get up, ye horsemen, and stand forth with your helmets; furbish the spears, and put on the brigandines.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why have I seen them dismayed and turned away back? and their mighty ones are beaten down and are fled in haste, and do not look back: for fear was round about, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let the swift flee away, nor the mighty man escape; they stumbled and fell toward the north by the river Euphrates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is this that comes up as a flood, whose waters move as rivers?
speaker: Narrator

text: Egypt rises up like a flood, and his waters move like rivers; and he said, I will go up and will cover the earth; I will destroy the city and its inhabitants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come up, ye horses; and rage, ye chariots; and let the mighty men come forth; the Ethiopians and the Libyans, that handle the shield; and the Lydians, that handle and bend the bow.
speaker: Narrator

text: But this day shall be unto the Lord GOD of the hosts, a day of vengeance, that he may avenge him of his adversaries; and the sword shall devour, and it shall be satiated and made drunk with their blood; for it shall be a slaughter unto the Lord GOD of the hosts in the north country by the river Euphrates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go up into Gilead, and take balm, O virgin, the daughter of Egypt: in vain shalt thou use many medicines; for there is no cure for thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The nations have heard of thy shame, and thy cry has filled the land; for the mighty man has stumbled against the mighty, and they are both fallen together.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word that the LORD spoke to Jeremiah the prophet, how Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon should come and smite the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Declare ye in Egypt, and publish in Migdol, and publish in Memphis and in Tahpanhes: say ye, Stand fast, and prepare thee; for the sword shall devour round about thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why is thy fortress swept away? It could not stand because the LORD pushed it over.
speaker: Narrator

text: He multiplied the fallen; yea, one fell upon another; and they said, Arise, and let us go again to our own people and to the land of our nativity, away from the overcoming sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: They cried there: Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a noise; he allowed the appointed time to pass by.
speaker: Narrator

text: As I live, saith the King, whose name is the LORD of the hosts, Surely as Tabor is among the mountains, and as Carmel by the sea, so shall he come.
speaker: Narrator

text: O thou daughter dwelling in Egypt, furnish thyself to go into captivity; for Memphis shall be a pasture and shall be made desolate without an inhabitant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Egypt is like a very fair heifer, but destruction comes; it comes out of the north.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also her soldiers are in the midst of her like fatted bullocks; for they also turned back, and all fled away without stopping: because the day of their calamity was come upon them and the time of their visitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her voice shall go forth like a serpent; for they shall march with an army and come against her with axes as hewers of wood.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall cut down her forest, saith the LORD, for they cannot be counted because they are more than the locusts; they are innumerable.
speaker: Narrator

text: The daughter of Egypt shall be confounded; she shall be delivered into the hand of the people of the north.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD of the hosts, the God of Israel, said: Behold, I will visit the multitude of Alexandria, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, with their gods, and their kings; even Pharaoh, and all those that trust in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will deliver them into the hand of those that seek their soul and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of his slaves; and afterward it shall be inhabited, as in the days of old, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: But fear not thou, O my slave Jacob, and be not dismayed, O Israel: for, behold, I will save thee from afar off, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return and be in rest and be prospered, and no one shall make him afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear thou not, O Jacob my slave, saith the LORD: for I am with thee; for I will make a full end of all the Gentiles where I have driven thee: but I will not make a full end of thee, but I will chastise thee with judgment; and I will not completely cut thee off.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet against the Palestinians, before Pharaoh smote Gaza.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD said: Behold, waters rise up out of the north and shall be an overflowing flood and shall overflow the land, and all that is therein; the cities and those that dwell therein; then the men shall cry, and all the inhabitants of the land shall howl.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the noise of the stamping of the hoofs of his strong horses, at the rushing of his chariots, and at the rumbling of his wheels, the fathers shall not look back to their children for feebleness of hands;
speaker: Narrator

text: because of the day that comes to destroy all the Palestinians, and to cut off from Tyre and Zidon every helper that remains: for the LORD will destroy the Palestinians, the remnant of the island of Caphtor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Baldness is come upon Gaza; Ashkelon is cut off with the remnant of their valley: how long wilt thou cut thyself?
speaker: Narrator

text: O thou sword of the LORD, how long will it be ere thou be quiet? put up thyself into thy scabbard, rest, and be still.
speaker: Narrator

text: How can it be quiet, seeing the LORD has given it a charge against Ashkelon and against the sea shore? there has he appointed it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Against Moab thus hath the LORD of the hosts, the God of Israel said; Woe unto Nebo! for it is destroyed; it is confounded; Kiriathaim is taken; Misgab is confounded and dismayed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moab shall no longer be praised; they have devised evil against Heshbon, saying, Come, and let us cut it off from being a nation. Also thou shalt be cut down, O Madmen; the sword shall pursue thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: A voice of crying shall be from Horonaim, spoiling and great destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moab is destroyed; they have caused the cry of her little ones to be heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in the ascending road of Luhith he that weeps shall go up weeping; for in the descending road of Horonaim the enemies have heard a cry of destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: Flee, save your lives, and be like the heath in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For because thou hast trusted in thy works; in thy treasures, thou shalt also be taken; and Chemosh shall go forth into captivity with his priests and his princes together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the spoiler shall come upon every city, and no city shall escape; the valley also shall perish, and the plain shall be destroyed as the LORD has spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give wings {Heb. open flowers} unto Moab that he may flee and get away, for his cities shall be desolate, without any to dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed be he that does the work of the LORD deceitfully, and cursed be he that keeps back his sword from blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moab has been at ease from his youth, and he has settled on his lees and has not been emptied from vessel to vessel, neither has he gone into captivity; therefore his taste remained in him, and his scent is not changed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, behold, the days come, said the LORD, that I will send unto him captors that shall take him captive and shall empty his vessels and break his wineskins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moab shall be ashamed of Chemosh as the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel their confidence.
speaker: Narrator

text: How do ye say, We are mighty and strong men for the war?
speaker: Narrator

text: Moab is spoiled, and his cities destroyed, and his chosen young men are gone down to the slaughter, said the King whose name is the LORD of the hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: The calamity of Moab is near to come, and his affliction hastens fast.
speaker: Narrator

text: All ye that are about him, bemoan him; and all ye that know his name, say, How is the strong staff broken: the beautiful rod!
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou daughter that dost inhabit Dibon, come down from thy glory, and sit in thirst; for the spoiler of Moab has come against thee and has dissipated thy strong holds.
speaker: Narrator

text: O inhabitant of Aroer, stand by the way and watch; ask her that flees and her that escapes and say, What has happened?
speaker: Narrator

text: Moab is confounded, for it is broken down; howl and cry; tell it in Arnon that Moab is spoiled,
speaker: Narrator

text: and judgment is come upon the plain country; upon Holon, and upon Jahazah, and upon Mephaath,
speaker: Narrator

text: and upon Dibon, and upon Nebo, and upon Bethdiblathaim,
speaker: Narrator

text: and upon Kiriathaim, and upon Bethgamul, and upon Bethmeon,
speaker: Narrator

text: and upon Kerioth, and upon Bozrah, and upon all the cities of the land of Moab, those that are far and those that are near.
speaker: Narrator

text: The horn of Moab is cut off, and his arm is broken, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make him drunken, for he magnified himself against the LORD; Moab shall also wallow in his vomit, and be in derision.
speaker: Narrator

text: For was not Israel a derision unto thee, as if he were found among thieves? for since thou hast spoken of him, thou hast slipped.
speaker: Narrator

text: O ye that dwell in Moab, leave the cities and dwell in the rock and be like the dove that makes her nest in the sides of the hole’s mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have heard the pride of Moab, (he is exceeding proud) his loftiness and his arrogancy and his pride and the haughtiness of his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know his wrath, saith the LORD, but it shall have no effect; his lies shall not be to his advantage.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will weep over Moab, and I will cry out for all Moab; my heart shall mourn for the men of Kirheres.
speaker: Narrator

text: O vine of Sibmah, I will weep for thee with the weeping of Jazer; thy shoots are gone over the sea; they reach even to the sea of Jazer; the spoiler is fallen upon thy summer fruits and upon thy vintage.
speaker: Narrator

text: And joy and gladness shall be taken from the plentiful field and from the land of Moab; and I shall cause wine to cease from the winepresses; no one shall tread with song; their song shall be no song.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cry, from Heshbon even unto Elealeh, and even unto Jahaz, they have uttered their voice; from Zoar even unto Horonaim, as a heifer of three years old; for the waters of Nimrim shall also be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover I will cause to cease in Moab, saith the LORD, him that offers upon an altar and him that burns incense to his gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore my heart shall sound like flutes for Moab, and my heart shall sound like flutes for the men of Kirheres because the riches that he has gotten are perished.
speaker: Narrator

text: For every head shall be bald, and every beard shaved: upon all the hands shall be cuttings, and upon all the loins sackcloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall be lamentation generally upon all the housetops of Moab and in the streets thereof; for I have broken Moab like a vessel in which there is no pleasure, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall howl, saying, How is it broken down! how has Moab turned the back with shame! so shall Moab be a derision and a dismaying to all those about him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus hath the LORD said: Behold, he shall fly as an eagle and shall spread his wings over Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities are taken, and the strong holds are taken, and the mighty men’s hearts in Moab at that day shall be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moab shall be destroyed from being a people because he has magnified himself against the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear and the pit and the snare shall be upon thee, O inhabitant of Moab, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that flees from the fear shall fall into the pit; and he that gets up out of the pit shall be taken in the snare; for I will bring upon him, even upon Moab, the year of their visitation, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that fled from the force stood under the shadow of Heshbon; because fire came forth out of Heshbon and a flame from the midst of Sihon and burned the corner of Moab and the crown of the head of the rebellious sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe be unto thee, O Moab! the people of Chemosh have perished; for thy sons are taken prisoners into captivity, and thy daughters are captives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I will turn again the captivity of Moab in the last of the times, said the LORD. Thus far is the judgment of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning the Ammonites, thus hath the LORD said: Does Israel have no sons? does he have no heir? why then does their king inherit Gad and his people dwell in his cities?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, behold, the days come, said the LORD, that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard in Rabbah of the Ammonites; and it shall be made a desolate heap, and her cities shall be burned with fire; then shall Israel be heir unto those that were his heirs, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howl, O Heshbon, for Ai is spoiled; cry, ye daughters of Rabbah, gird yourselves with sackcloth; lament and run to and fro by the hedges, for their king shall go into captivity, and his priests and his princes together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why gloriest thou in the valleys? Thy valley has slipped, O backsliding daughter that trusted in her treasures, she that saith, Who shall come against me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I bring fear upon thee, saith the Lord GOD of the hosts, from all sides; and ye shall be driven out each man right forth in the direction he is facing; and no one shall gather up him that wanders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward I will turn again the captivity of the sons of Ammon, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning Edom, thus hath the LORD of the hosts said: Is there no more wisdom in Teman? Has the counsel of the wise perished? Is their wisdom corrupted?
speaker: Narrator

text: Flee, turn back, hide in the deeps to remain, O inhabitants of Dedan; for I will bring the calamity of Esau upon him, at the time that I have to visit him.
speaker: Narrator

text: If grapegatherers came against thee, would they not leave some gleaning grapes? If thieves by night, they will take what they have need of.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will make Esau bare, I will uncover his secret places, and he shall not be able to hide himself; his seed shall be destroyed, and his brethren and his neighbours and he shall no longer be.
speaker: Narrator

text: Leave thy fatherless children; I will raise them; and thy widows shall trust in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus hath the LORD said: Behold, those who were not condemned to drink of the cup have assuredly drunken; and shalt thou be absolved of everything? Thou shalt not be absolved, but thou shalt surely drink of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have sworn by myself, said the LORD, that Bozrah shall become a desolation, a reproach, a waste, and a curse; and all its cities shall be perpetual wastes.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have heard the news, that from the LORD a messenger had been sent unto the Gentiles, saying, Gather ye together, and come against her, and rise up to the battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, I have placed thee as small among the Gentiles and despised among men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy arrogance has deceived thee, and the pride of thine heart, O thou that dost dwell in the clefts of the rock, that dost hold the height of the mountain: though thou should make thy nest as high as the eagle, I will bring thee down from there, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Edom shall be a desolation; every one that goes by it shall be astonished and shall hiss at all its plagues.
speaker: Narrator

text: As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour cities thereof, said the LORD, no man shall abide there, neither shall a son of man dwell in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan to the strong habitation: for I will make rest and make him run from upon her, and he who is chosen I shall appoint over her; for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that shepherd that will stand before me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore hear the counsel of the LORD that he has taken against Edom; and his thoughts, that he has purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out; surely he shall destroy their habitations with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth is moved at the noise of their fall; at the cry the noise thereof was heard in the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, he shall rise up and fly as the eagle and spread his wings over Bozrah; and at that day the heart of the mighty men of Edom shall be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning Damascus. Hamath is con­founded, and Arpad, for they have heard bad news; they have melted in waters of feebleness; they cannot be reassured.
speaker: Narrator

text: Damascus is waxed feeble and turns herself to flee, and fear has seized on her; anguish and sorrows have taken her as a woman in travail.
speaker: Narrator

text: How did they not forgive the city of praise, the city of my joy!
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, and all the men of war shall be cut off in that day, said the LORD of the hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it shall consume the houses of Benhadad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning Kedar, and concerning the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote, thus hath the LORD said; Arise ye, go up to Kedar and destroy the men of the east.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their tents and their flocks shall they take away; they shall take to themselves their curtains and all their vessels and their camels; and they shall invoke fear on every side against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Flee, get you far off, dwell in the deeps that ye may stand, O ye inhabitants of Hazor, said the LORD; for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon has taken counsel against you and has conceived a purpose against you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, get you up unto the wealthy nation that dwells without care, saith the LORD, which has neither gates nor bars, which dwells alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their camels shall be a booty, and the multitude of their cattle a spoil: and I will scatter them into all the winds, throwing them out unto the utmost corner; and from all their sides I will bring their ruin, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hazor shall be a dwelling for dragons and a desolation for ever: no man shall abide there, nor any son of man dwell in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet regarding Elam in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD of the hosts said: Behold, I break the bow of Elam, the foundation of their might.
speaker: Narrator

text: And upon Elam I will bring the four winds from the four quarters of heaven and will scatter them toward all those winds; and there shall be no nation where the outcasts of Elam shall not come.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will cause Elam to fear before their enemies and before those that seek their soul; and I will bring evil upon them, even my fierce anger, said the LORD; and I will send the sword after them until I have consumed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will set my throne in Elam and will destroy from there the king and the princes, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it shall come to pass in the last of the days that I will turn again the captivity of Elam, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word that the LORD spoke against Babylon and against the land of the Chaldeans by the hand of Jeremiah the prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Declare ye among the Gentiles, and publish, and set up a banner; publish, and do not conceal: say, Babylon is taken, Bel is confounded, Merodach is broken in pieces; her idols are confounded, her images are broken in pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: For out of the north there comes up a nation against her, which shall make her land desolate, and no one shall dwell therein: they shall leave, they shall depart, both man and beast.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days, and in that time, saith the LORD, the sons of Israel shall come, they and the sons of Judah together, going and weeping they shall go and seek the LORD their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall ask the way to Zion, unto where they shall turn their faces, saying, Come, and let us join ourselves to the LORD in an eternal covenant that shall never be forgotten.
speaker: Narrator

text: My people have been lost sheep; their shepherds have caused them to go astray; they have turned them away on the mountains; they have gone from mountain to hill; they have forgotten their restingplace.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that found them have devoured them; and their adversaries said, We are not guilty because they have sinned against the LORD, the habitation of justice, even the LORD, the hope of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Flee out of the midst of Babylon, and go forth out of the land of the Chaldeans, and be as the meek in front of the flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, I awake and cause to come up against Babylon an assembly of great nations from the north country, and from there they shall set themselves in array against her; she shall be taken; their arrows shall be as of a mighty expert one, who shall not return in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the land of the Chaldeans shall be for a spoil; all that spoil her shall come forth full, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because ye were glad, because ye rejoiced destroying my heritage, because ye filled yourselves as a heifer on grass and neighed like horses;
speaker: Narrator

text: your mother was sore confounded; she that bore you was ashamed: see here the latter end of the Gentiles: wilderness, dry land, and desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of the wrath of the LORD, she shall not be inhabited, but she shall be completely desolate; every one that goes by Babylon shall be astonished and hiss at all her plagues.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put yourselves in array against Babylon round about; all ye that bend the bow, shoot at her, spare no arrows; for she has sinned against the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shout against her round about; she has given her hand; her foundations are fallen; her walls are thrown down: for it is the vengeance of the LORD; take vengeance upon her; as she has done, do unto her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cut off the sower from Babylon and him that handles the sickle in the time of harvest; for fear of the oppressing sword they shall turn each one to his people, and they shall flee each one to his own land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel has been like scattered sheep; the lions have driven him away; first the king of Assyria has devoured him; and last this Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon has broken his bones.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus hath the LORD of the hosts, the God of Israel said; Behold, I visit the king of Babylon and his land as I have visited the king of Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will bring Israel again to his habitation, and he shall feed on Carmel and Bashan, and his soul shall be satisfied upon Mount Ephraim and Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days, and in that time, said the LORD, the iniquity of Israel shall be sought for, and there shall be none; and the sins of Judah, and they shall not be found: for I will pardon those whom I shall have left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go up against the land of Merathaim, even against it and against the inhabitants of Pekod; waste and utterly destroy after them, said the LORD, and do according to all that I have commanded thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: A sound of battle is in the land and of great destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: How is the hammer of the whole earth cut asunder and broken! How is Babylon become a desolation among the Gentiles!
speaker: Narrator

text: I have laid a snare for thee, and thou art also taken, O Babylon, and thou wast not aware; thou art found, and also caught because thou hast provoked the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD has opened his treasury and has brought forth the vessels of his indignation; for this is the work of the Lord GOD of the hosts in the land of the Chaldeans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come against her from the ends of the earth, open her storehouses; cast her up as heaps and destroy her utterly: let nothing of her be left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Slay all her bullocks; let them go down to the slaughter. Woe unto them! for their day is come, the time of their visitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of those that flee and escape out of the land of Babylon, to declare in Zion the vengeance of the LORD our God, the vengeance of his temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: Call together the archers against Babylon; all ye that bend the bow, camp against it round about; let none thereof escape: recompense her according to her work; according to all that she has done, do unto her; for she has become proud against the LORD, against the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall her young men fall in her streets, and all her men of war shall be cut off in that day, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I am against thee, O thou proud one, said the Lord GOD of the hosts; for thy day is come, the time that I will visit thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the proud one shall stumble and fall and have no one to raise him up: and I will kindle a fire in his cities, and it shall devour all round about him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD of the hosts said: The sons of Israel and the sons of Judah were oppressed together; and all that took them captives held them fast; they refused to let them go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their Redeemer is strong; the LORD of the hosts is his name: he shall thoroughly plead their cause that he may give rest to the land and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: A sword is upon the Chaldeans, said the LORD, and upon the inhabitants of Babylon and upon her princes and upon her wise men.
speaker: Narrator

text: A sword is upon the fortune-tellers; and they shall be fools: a sword is upon her mighty men; and they shall be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: A sword is upon their horses and upon their chariots and upon all the mingled people that are in the midst of her; and they shall become as women; a sword is upon her treasures; and they shall be robbed.
speaker: Narrator

text: A drought is upon her waters; and they shall be dried up; for it is the land of graven images, and they are become mad upon their idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the wild beasts of the desert with the wild beasts of the islands shall dwell there, and the owls shall dwell therein: and it shall no longer be inhabited for ever; neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: As God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour cities thereof, saith the LORD; so shall no man abide there, neither shall any son of man dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, a people comes from the north, and a great nation and many kings shall be raised up from the coasts of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall hold the bow and the lance; they shall be cruel and will not show mercy: their voice shall roar like the sea, and they shall ride upon horses, every one put in array, like a man to the battle, against thee, O daughter of Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Babylon has heard the report of them, and his hands waxed feeble; anguish took hold of him, and pangs as of a woman in travail.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan unto the strong habitation; but I will rest and will make him run from upon her; and he who shall be chosen I will appoint over her. For who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that shepherd that will stand before me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore hear ye the counsel of the LORD that he has taken against Babylon and his thoughts that he has purposed against the land of the Chaldeans: Surely the least of the flock shall drag them out, and they shall destroy their habitations with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the noise of the taking of Babylon, the earth was moved, and the cry was heard among the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD said; Behold, I raise up against Babylon and against her inhabitants that rise up against me from the heart, a destroying wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will send unto Babylon fanners that shall fan her and shall empty her land; for in the day of trouble they shall be against her round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: I shall say to the archer that bends his bow and unto him that lifts himself up in his brigandine, Spare ye not her young men; utterly destroy all her host.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the slain shall fall in the land of the Chaldeans and those that are thrust through in her streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Israel and Judah have not been made widows of their God, of the LORD of the hosts, though their land was filled with sin against the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Flee out of the midst of Babylon and deliver each one his soul that ye not perish because of her iniquity, for this is the time of the LORD’s vengeance; he will render unto her a recompense.
speaker: Narrator

text: Babylon has been a golden cup in the LORD’s hand that made all the earth drunken: the Gentiles have drunken of her wine; therefore the nations are mad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Babylon is suddenly fallen and destroyed; howl for her; take balm for her pain, if so be she may be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: We applied the medicine to Babylon, but she is not healed: forsake her, and let us go each one into his own land; for her judgment is come unto heaven and is lifted up even to the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD has brought our righteousness to light; come, and let us declare in Zion the work of the LORD our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make bright the arrows; gather the shields; the LORD has awakened the spirit of the kings of the Medes; for his thought is against Babylon to destroy her; for it is vengeance of the LORD, the vengeance of his temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: Set up the banner upon the walls of Babylon, make the watch strong, set up the watchmen, prepare the ambushes; for the LORD has deliberated and shall put into effect that which he spoke against the inhabitants of Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: O thou that dwellest among many waters, rich in treasures, thine end is come, the measure of thy covetousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD of the hosts has sworn by himself, saying, Surely I will fill thee with men as with locusts; and they shall sing the song of the winepress against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is the one who makes the earth by his power; he upholds the world by his wisdom and extends the heavens by his intelligence;
speaker: Narrator

text: he who gives with his voice a multitude of waters from heaven, then he causes the clouds to ascend from the ends of the earth; he makes lightnings with the rain and brings forth the wind out of his treasures.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every man has become carnal and is without knowledge; let every founder be ashamed of the graven image: for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are vanity, the work of errors; in the time of their visitation they shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: The portion of Jacob is not like them; for he is the Former of all things; and Israel is the rod of his inheritance; the LORD of the hosts is his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art my hammer, O weapons of war: for with thee I will break in pieces the Gentiles, and with thee I will destroy kingdoms;
speaker: Narrator

text: and with thee I will break in pieces the horse and his rider; and with thee I will break in pieces the chariots and their riders;
speaker: Narrator

text: with thee also I will break in pieces men and women; and with thee I will break in pieces old and young; and with thee I will break in pieces young men and virgins;
speaker: Narrator

text: I will also break in pieces with thee the shepherd and his flock; and with thee I will break in pieces the husbandman and his yoke of oxen; and with thee I will break in pieces dukes and princes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will render unto Babylon and to all the inhabitants of Chaldea all their evil that they have done in Zion in your sight, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I am against thee, O destroying mountain, said the LORD, which destroys all the earth; and I will stretch out my hand upon thee and roll thee down from the rocks and will make thee a burnt mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall not take of thee a stone for a corner, nor a stone for foundations; but thou shalt be desolate for ever, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Set ye up a banner in the land, blow the shofar among the Gentiles, prepare the nations against her, call together against her the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni, and Ashchenaz; appoint a captain against her; cause the horses to come up as raised up locusts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Prepare the nations against her: the kings of Media, the captains thereof, and all the princes thereof, and all the land of their dominion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the land shall tremble and sorrow for every thought of the LORD is confirmed against Babylon, to make the land of Babylon a desolation without an inhabitant.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mighty men of Babylon have forborne to fight; they have remained in their holds; their might has failed; they became as women: the enemies have burned her dwelling places; they have broken her bars.
speaker: Narrator

text: One post shall run to meet another, and one messenger to meet another, to show the king of Babylon that his city is taken in all places,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fords were taken, and they have burned the reeds with fire, and the men of war were astounded.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus hath the LORD of the hosts, the God of Israel said: The daughter of Babylon is like a threshingfloor; it is now time to thresh her: yet a little while, and the time of her harvest shall come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon has devoured me; he has crushed me; he has made me an empty vessel, he has swallowed me up like a dragon; he has filled his belly with my delicates; he has cast me out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The violence against me and my flesh be upon Babylon, shall the inhabitant of Zion say; and my blood upon the inhabitants of Chaldea, shall Jerusalem say.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus hath the LORD said: Behold, I judge thy cause and shall take thy vengeance; and I will dry up her sea and make her flowing waters dry.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Babylon shall become heaps, a dwelling place for dragons, an astonishment, and a hissing, without an inhabitant.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall roar together like lions; they shall roar as lions’ whelps.
speaker: Narrator

text: In their heat I will place their feasts before them, and I will make them drunken that they may rejoice and sleep an eternal sleep and not wake, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with he goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: How is Sheshach a prey! and how is she who was the praise of the whole earth taken! how is Babylon become an astonishment among the Gentiles!
speaker: Narrator

text: The sea is come up upon Babylon; she is covered with the multitude of the waves thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her cities were devastated, the land dry and desert, a land in which no man dwells, neither shall any son of man pass thereby.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will visit Bel himself in Babylon, and I will bring forth out of his mouth that which he has swallowed up; and the Gentiles shall not flow together any more unto him; and the wall of Babylon shall fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come out of the midst of her, my people, and save each one his life from the fierce anger of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And lest your heart faint, and ye fear because of the news that shall be heard in the land; in one year shall the news come, and after that in the next year shall come the rumour, and then shall come the violence in the land, and the ruler over him who rules.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, behold, the days come that I will visit the graven images of Babylon; and her whole land shall be ashamed, and all her dead shall fall in the midst of her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the heavens and the earth and all that is therein shall sing praises over Babylon; for the destroyers shall come unto her from the north, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Babylon has caused the dead of Israel to fall, so because of Babylon the dead of all the earth fell.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye that have escaped the sword, go away, do not tarry: remember the LORD for many days, and remember Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are ashamed, because we have heard the reproach; confusion has covered our faces; for strangers are come against the sanctuaries of the LORD’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, behold, the days come, said the LORD, that I will visit her graven images; and through all her land the wounded unto death shall groan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though Babylon should mount up to heaven, and though she should fortify her strength upon high, yet from me shall destroyers come unto her, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sound of a cry comes from Babylon, and great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans!
speaker: Narrator

text: Because the LORD destroys Babylon and takes out of her the many thunders, her waves shall roar; like many waters shall be the sound of their voice:
speaker: Narrator

text: because the destroyer is come against her, even upon Babylon, and her mighty men are taken, their bow is broken: for the LORD God of recompenses shall surely requite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make drunk her princes, and her wise men, her captains, and her rulers, and her mighty men; and they shall sleep an eternal sleep and shall not wake, saith the King, whose name is the LORD of the hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus hath the LORD of the hosts said; The broad walls of Babylon shall be utterly cast down, and her high gates shall be burned with fire; and peoples and nations shall labour in vain in the fire to save her, and they shall become weary.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word which Jeremiah the prophet sent to Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Maaseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah into Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. And this Seraiah was the chief steward of the bedchambers.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jeremiah wrote in a book all the evil that should come upon Babylon, even all these words that are written against Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, When thou comest to Babylon and shalt see and shalt read all these things;
speaker: Narrator

text: then thou shalt say, O LORD, thou hast spoken against this place, to cut it off, that no one shall remain in it, neither man nor beast, but that it shall be desolate for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be, when thou hast made an end of reading this book, that thou shalt bind a stone to it, and cast it into the midst of Euphrates;
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou shalt say, Thus shall Babylon sink and shall not rise from the evil that I will bring upon her: and they shall be overcome. Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he did that which was evil in the eyes of the LORD, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.
speaker: Narrator

text: For because of the anger of the LORD against Jerusalem and Judah, until he had cast them out of his presence, Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore it came to pass after nine years of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon came, he and all his army, against Jerusalem and pitched camp against it and built forts against it round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the city was besieged unto the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the fourth month, in the ninth day of the month, the famine prevailed in the city, so that there was no bread for the people of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the city was breached, and all the men of war fled and went forth out of the city by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, which was by the king’s garden, and they went by the way of the desert, even though the Chaldeans were by the city round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued after the king and took Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho; and all his army was scattered from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they took the king and caused him to come up unto the king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath where he pronounced the sentence upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes; he slew also all the princes of Judah in Riblah.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he put out the eyes of Zedekiah and bound him in chains; and the king of Babylon caused him to be taken to Babylon and put him in prison until the day of his death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the fifth month, in the tenth day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, came Nebuzaradan, captain of the guard, who served the king of Babylon, into Jerusalem
speaker: Narrator

text: and burned the house of the LORD and the king’s house and all the houses of Jerusalem, and every great house he burned with fire:
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the army of the Chaldeans, that were with the captain of the guard, destroyed all the walls of Jerusalem round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive certain of the poor of the people, and the residue of the people that remained in the city, and the fugitives that had fled to the king of Babylon, and the rest of the multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left certain of the poor of the land for vinedressers and for husbandmen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the pillars of brass that were in the house of the LORD, and the bases, and the brazen sea that was in the house of the LORD, the Chaldeans broke, and carried all the brass of them to Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: The caldrons also, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the bowls, and the spoons, and all the vessels of brass with which they ministered, they took away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the basins, and the censers, and the bowls, and the caldrons, and the lampstands, and the spoons, and the cups; that which was of gold in gold, and that which was of silver in silver, the captain of the guard took away.
speaker: Narrator

text: The two pillars, one sea, and twelve brazen bulls that were under the bases, which King Solomon had made in the house of the LORD; the brass of all these vessels could not be weighed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And concerning the pillars, the height of one pillar was eighteen cubits; and a fillet of twelve cubits did compass it; and the thickness thereof was four fingers: it was hollow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a chapiter of brass was upon it; and the height of one chapiter was five cubits, with network and pomegranates upon the chapiters round about, all of brass. The second pillar also and the pomegranates were like unto these.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there were ninety-six pomegranates on a side; and all the pomegranates upon the network were one hundred round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the door.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also took out of the city a eunuch, who had the charge of the men of war; and seven men of those that were near the king’s person, who were found in the city; and the principal scribe of the host, who mustered the people of the land for war; and sixty men of the people of the land, that were found in the midst of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Babylon smote them, and put them to death in Riblah in the land of Hamath. Thus Judah was carried away captive out of his own land.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the people whom Nebuchadrezzar carried away captive: in the seventh year three thousand and twenty-three Jews:
speaker: Narrator

text: In the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar he carried away captive from Jerusalem eight hundred thirty-two persons:
speaker: Narrator

text: In the twenty-third year of Nebuchadrezzar Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the Jews seven hundred forty-five persons: all the persons were four thousand six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in the thirty-seventh year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, in the twenty-fifth day of the month, that Evilmerodach king of Babylon in the first year of his reign lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah and brought him forth out of prison
speaker: Narrator

text: and spoke kindly unto him and set his seat above the seat of the kings that were with him in Babylon
speaker: Narrator

text: and changed his prison garments: and he continually ate bread before him all the days of his life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for his diet, there was a continual diet given him of the king of Babylon, every thing in its day for all the days of his life, until the day of his death.
speaker: Narrator
